question: Howard Cosell, you are an instigator! How you get that way? When I'm done with Liston, I'm comin' for you!
answer: I'm called Bundini, rhymes with Houdini. He was a Jew, too...some other people call me Fastblack...or Daddy Mac... Shorty sent me to Sugar Ray Robinson. I gave my power to Sugar Ray for seven years, gave him my voodoo, my magic. Now Shorty sent me to you.

question: Who Shorty?
answer: I call him Shorty 'cause he like 'em circumcised. Original people. Like Moses. And I was a babe in a basket, too. I was born on a doorstep with a note 'cross my chest that read, "Do the best you can for him, world." I had to suck the first nipple come along. I didn't run away from home...I been runnin' to home. Now, I gotta ask you. You fixin' them fights? Else no way you could tell great Archie Moore what round you droppin' him in...all of them predictions you make, comin' true. Never heard of nobody predictin' the round like you. You either a phony or Shorty's in your corner. Tell me the truth, young man...

question: ...I study every fight. 'Til I got a plan. Wear him down two through four. Drop him in the fifth round. So the p'diction ain't a p'diction. It's a plan. And 'cause of all the poppin' off I do, I know I gotta win! That's the truth. And why I'm tellin' you?
answer: 'Cause I'm gonna be your Inspiration. Your motivator. In your corner. Can I be in your corner, young man?

question: Yeah...
answer: Ain't spent much time in Miami. Where the water?

question: ...Clay, a round ago, looked like he'd about had it, but in round six... Sonny Liston is not coming out! Wait a minute! Wait a minute! Sonny Liston is not coming out! The winner...and the new heavyweight champion of the world is Cassius Clay!
answer: I upset the world! I am the greatest! I am the greatest! Eat your words! Eat your words!

question: What made him so easy for you?
answer: I told you. Didn't I tell you?

question: Was there any single point you knew you had him?
answer: I had him in the first round. 'Cause I'm the greatest! Sam... Hey, Sam! Let him up. I am the greatest! And he the greatest rock 'n' roll singer. Sam Cooke! I want everybody to bear witness. I shook up the world! Don't have a mark on me! I was burning. I was blind. I'm the prettiest thing that ever lived. I shook up the world! I shook up the world!

question: Man, look at that guy run!
answer: The Mummy! "I can't get away from the mummy!" Yeah, but that mummy too slow to catch anybody. No, he don't! Now, don't believe that stuff on television... Yeah. I going to be a people's champ... But not like Joe Louis, exactly... And I'm not Clay. Clay's the name of the people who owned by ancestors. I don't want to be called after that slave name no more. So I'm "X." Cassius X. And I'm a member of the Nation of Islam. The Honorable Elijah Muhammad is my spiritual guide. Malcolm X is my mentor. "Card-carrying"...? Don't need no "card." You got a Christian card? 750 million people believe in Islam. I'm one of them.

question: This is the champ's time. And I'm here as a friend to celebrate his victory. So I got nothing you want...
answer: I'm going to be a people's champion. But I don't have to be the way you want me to be. I'm gonna be what I want. And I'm free to think any way I want...

question: I was leaving, saw the light on...how come you're up?
answer: ...watchin' a show on termites...they knockin' down this house, here.

question: I been invited to speak at Ibadan University in Nigeria. C'mon with me?
answer: Six million in your house and you don't know it. Where?

question: Africa. You been there?
answer: Africa? No. Only Rome. Yeah, man, let's go!

question: Nkrumah stayed with me when he was a student in New York, so we'll stop in Ghana...
answer: When we leaving?

question: Next Thursday.
answer: What is it?

question: You ever been so angry...have you ever been so angry that you'd explode?
answer: Tore out a picture of Emmett Till when I was little. Couldn't take my eyes to it...couldn't look at it. Barb-wire around his neck to a 75- pound cotton-gin fan. Took out his eye. The cruelty to it...I couldn't look at it...couldn't throw it away.

question: What else?
answer: I thought, "What I do wrong to be so low that people could do that to people like me?" It made me feel ashamed. And that makes no sense. But that's what it was.

question: ...when I heard about the four girls bombed in the 16th Street Church in Birmingham? The prohibitions of the Honorable Elijah Muhammad prevented me from speaking my voice in action. Because Birmingham was part of the civil rights movement, begging for a place at the white man's table... But dead children...are dead children. So the anger I felt, I had to contain. I locked that down! So tight my muscles seized. I lost control over the right side of my body. Leg didn't work...right arm didn't work. "I'm having a stroke," I thought. I had to hold it in 'cause I wanted, all I wanted was to BREAK SOMETHING! Break a part...any part of this system. Because you are so provoked as a human being. In your spirit. In your heart... At the death of children. But I COULD DO...nothing. Everyone knows... Now I'm advocating more direct political action involvement with the international struggle... So Elijah Muhammad has suspended me as a Minister in the Nation of Islam for 90 days.
answer: You can fix that...

question: Only after long service and high merit in the spiritual and physical rebirth of Afro-American people...is one granted an original name. But you are special. A world champion. So there is a gift I wish to give you. From this day forward you will be known as Muhammad Ali...which means "one worthy of praise," and Ali means "most high."
answer: Muhammad Ali. "Worthy of praise..." Thank you!

question: Be very careful what you say...your words reflect on the nation of Islam, now.
answer: Yes, sir.

question: Up until now, I have entrusted your spiritual development to Brother Malcolm. I do not feel this is a wise course anymore. Malcolm has gone off into the secular world and does not measure his words. I have decided to give you, as your guide, my very own son, Herbert Muhammad. Herbert will supervise all of your spiritual and material needs.
answer: This is a great honor, Messenger...

question: When the contract run out. I want black lawyers and managers. Chauncey Eskridge on North La Salle Street... I don't need no "protectin'" from myself. Why I need protecting from myself by them...? I ain't one of their thoroughbreds! Or their charity things. "Let's do somethin' for that well-behaved colored boy, Cassius." I ain't well-behaved nothing! I am a man. And I am not Cassius. I changed my name. I am Muhammad Ali, now. That's right. No one "made me"... I made me. No one's in that ring but me! I know who I'm not...I'm not drinkin'! Goin' back on my wife! I am not prayin' to no blue-eyed, blonde-haired Jesus. I ain't... You saying I'm just like him?
answer: What is it, Joseph? Cassius won't be coming to Africa...not with me.

question: Hey, man, where they put the real pilot? What you doin' up here? No, man, I meant...in L'ville, when I growed up, they barely let black folks drive buses.
answer: How about Gamilah or Khalilah?

question: in the three-car caravan, passes the huge triumphal arch with its giant black star on the top. Thousands line the route to see the heavyweight champion and cheer him. For Ali it's another kind of parade...
answer: Brother Muhammad...

question: Hey, man!!! How you doin'? What's up, brother? I knew you were here...didn't think you were still here...
answer: And I heard you were coming.

question: We just got here now... And, maaan, the brothers were flyin' a DC 8. Flippin' switches, navigatin', filing flight plans, talkin' French... Where you goin'?
answer: When...uh, Liberia. When you fighting Liston?

question: November.
answer: This is Maya Angelou and Ambassador Huang Ha. Amando Gonzalez is from Cuba. Taher Kaid is the Ambassador from Algeria.

question: Man, where should I go? We're planning on Egypt.
answer: Algeria. See Ben Bella... Go to Mecca, Medina. I just came back. Made my seven circuits around the Kaaba, prayed at sunrise... There were two million people...pilgrims from all over. Dressed all the same, high and low, the same. Blonde-haired, blue-eyed Muslims. Arabs. Blacks. Yeah. All of them, Muslims praying together.

question: Algeria. See Ben Bella... Go to Mecca, Medina. I just came back. Made my seven circuits around the Kaaba, prayed at sunrise... There were two million people...pilgrims from all over. Dressed all the same, high and low, the same. Blonde-haired, blue-eyed Muslims. Arabs. Blacks. Yeah. All of them, Muslims praying together.
answer: Hello...?

question: It's Marlin. You'll never guess who Malcolm ran into...
answer: Un moment... Hold on a second... Il n'y a pas de quoi. Cela m'a fait grand plaisir. Faites-lui mes compliments. It's nothing. Give him my compliments. I thought that was all over. Is Clay going to support Malcolm's U.N. resolution? Find out. We'll pick up on Malcolm in Liberia ourselves.

question: Drank from the well of Zem-Zem... And you should visit Cairo. I have friends there in...
answer: ...shouldn't have quarreled with the Honorable Elijah... You shouldn't have... ...quarreled with the honorable Elijah Muhammad...

question: What?
answer: You shouldn't have quarreled with Elijah Muhammad.

question: Brother Muhammad... Brother Muhammad...!
answer: Sonji...Sonji Roi...

question: Sonji...Sonji Roi...
answer: What you keep sayin' my name for?

question: 'Cause I love it, girl. How long you been workin' for Herbert?
answer: 'Bout a year. I sell "Muhammad Speaks" over the phone...

question: What kind of name is that?
answer: My father named me after Sonja Henie.

question: What's your father do?
answer: He was shot in a poker game when I was two. He don't do nothin'. Sonja, on the other hand, was an ice skater, and my mother died when I was eleven.

question: So who raised you?
answer: Godparents, but I been on my own, doing my own thing...

question: Whatcha doin' tomorrow? Go ridin' with me.
answer: No. I gotta work, you know.

question: I square it with Herbert. I got a record player in my car.
answer: A record player? C'mon. How come it don't skip?

question: Got springs and stuff.
answer: Herbert said you met The Beatles.

question: Yeah. Only one of 'em's smart...the one with the glasses.
answer: ...he's my favorite.

question: People all screaming and fainting. I asked him, "This the way they act when you get big?"
answer: What he say?

question: He said, "Champ. The more real you get, the more unreal it gonna get."
answer: Wow...

question: Let's go...
answer: Yeah...

question: Where you live?
answer: I'm takin' you there...

question: I think I gonna keep you around forever, girl.
answer: Well, I'm not too busy right now, so...I'll think on it.

question: Herbert said you weren't a Muslim.
answer: Cover my hair? No make-up? Long dresses? Honey, please. Were you a virgin?

question: Why?
answer: 'Cause you so "gone" off a little good time.

question: I'm no virgin...but I may as well be. I ain't jokin'! I always know when I know. See this face? I mean, you got a pretty face for a girl's face, but you ever seen somethin' as pretty as me? Now, you about five-foot-three...that's too small. But I overlook that, too, 'cause...
answer: Thank you so much.

question: ...'cause of your spirit!
answer: My "spirit"...?

question: Yeah. 'Cause you too much fun!
answer: You serious?

question: But you gotta be a Muslim.
answer: Huh? How you do that? Step over a broom...shazaam...you a Muslim?

question: Maaan, I ain't never been with a girl like you.
answer: Baby, maybe you ain't ever gonna be with any other.

question: What? You were the first...you walked me forward, my brother...you were the first...
answer: ...the arena is surrounded by FBI, the stands are only half full, the promoter has taken out a million- dollar insurance policy due to Cassius Clay's membership in the militant and radical Black Muslims because of death threats. Oh, and by the way...Sonny Liston is here, too.

question: meets Liston, nails him with a straight right. Ali begins baiting him, dancing. Liston tries to cut off the ring, jabbing ineffectually. Ali lets Liston in, pulls back, then pivots on his right foot, throws a short right and RAMP INTO SLO-MO...to see Liston not see it coming.
answer: Liston is down! Scarcely a minute into the first round, I can't believe it!

question: Get up, sucker! Get up and fight! No one gonna believe this!
answer: It's over; it's over!

question: You okay? What's wrong?
answer: Why you done up like that?

question: I'm dyin' and...'cause this is how I dress! I dyin' for you out of worry...
answer: "Worry"...?

question: Yeah. And all you care about is if I look dull enough?
answer: The world looks at me, girl! What if I straightened my hair, live in the white suburbs? How I am says something!

question: Well, sorry you don't like how I am...
answer: Where's Herbert? What do I do...?

question: "Satisfied?"...satisfaction is not makin' it with the woman who send you to the moon? Man, I'm the only normal person left around here and I'm a black Jew who can't read and is half drunk.
answer: Please stay, Brother Herbert. I ain't dead! Yeah?

question: He so pretty, when you look up "pretty" in the dictionary, he too pretty to be there.
answer: Huh? What you talking about?

question: Champ. It's Eskridge...
answer: You know about this?

question: ...I flunk their draft board test. Now, without testing if I am "wiser" or "worser," they decide I can go into the Army.
answer: Cassius, it is my opinion you...

question: And I'm not Cassius Clay. That's a slave name. I'm a free man. I'm Muhammad Ali.
answer: You know, I apologize to you. On the air. Your name is Muhammad Ali. You have the right to be called whatever you want.

question: You make a lot of mistakes for a so-called educated man. You really go to law school?
answer: Yes, Muhammad. And to think I gave up a lucrative practice for the likes of you.

question: I'm the best thing that ever happened to you, Howard Cosell. Without me you be a tall white man with a microphone in his mouth.
answer: And without me...you'd be a mouth. We'll be right back. Have a little coffee with your sugar...?

question: Keep talking. You were saying something half-smart...
answer: They want to make an example out of you.

question: Why? I'm no Stokely Carmichael, H. Rap Brown...
answer: All they are is political. They tell people how they ought to be. But you are the HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION of the WORLD. You're important. And they don't like your militancy, your politics. So, they'll make an example out of you.

question: ...of a good "Ne-gro," who do what he told?
answer: Yes. Or, to demonstrate here is what happens to your ass if you don't...

question: So what? I ain't gonna be what anybody else want me to be. I'm not afraid to be what I want. And think how I want.
answer: a New York lawyer and promoter arrives and climbs out of the Oldsmobile. Ali opens the door...but doesn't get out...

question: People are following me...
answer: I got almost nowhere I can promote a fight for you. Plus, I think they're going to vacate you from the crown.

question: What?
answer: Yeah. If you're convicted.

question: They gonna take away what no fighter in the world can?
answer: And New York may revoke your boxing license.

question: What 'bout Terrell?
answer: We'll know if we can fight Terrell in Illinois this afternoon. Terrell's running his mouth. He said if you're called, you should serve...

question: Motherfucker. He got a deferment for bein' too tall, or havin' flat feet. Why don't he serve for me? Tellin' me what I should do...
answer: I got to get you some fights. Fast.

question: Yes. Apologize? No. Yes, sir! Yes, sir. I am not going to apologize to you. This isn't a courtroom. And I don't have to sit here and answer your questions. I ain't draft dodgin'! I ain't goin' to Canada. I ain't burnin' my draft card. I ain't burnin' the flag. I'm stayin' right here. And you want to throw me in jail? Go ahead. I'll do my time. I been in jail four hundred years. I'll be in jail four, five more. But I ain't goin' ten thousand miles to help murder and kill poor people for you. 'Cause if I'm gonna die, I'll die now, right here, fighting you. If I wanna die. You my enemy, not Vietcong or Chinese or Japanese. You my opposer when I want freedom. You my opposer when I want justice. You my opposer when I want equality. You want me to go somewhere for you, but you won't even stand up for me in America, for my rights and beliefs, you won't even stand up for me here at home. What...? What you call me...? Announce it right here or from flat on your back! What's my name?!? What's my name, motherfucker?! What's my name? Ali, at the apex of his athletic skills, fires six- or eight-punch combinations and then changes direction. Ali shoots jabs and hooks going backwards; every move and set of combinations is a dance. Ali's never been as light on his feet, as fast, as complex as in this fight. Like any moment of greatness, we want it to last forever... Then, Ali throws a 17-punch combination. WHAT'S MY NAME?! My name?! WHAT'S MY NAME?! If the court would give me my sentence right now instead of waiting and stalling. Watch now... Blow on it... This spooky! Don't get scared...
answer: See, you don't need to fight no more...

question: So what's fresh, girl?
answer: Everything fresh!

question: What's the freshest of the freshest?
answer: Doughnuts just came out...

question: Feed me those things, I gotta come back as a wrassler. 645 pounds. I'd still be pretty...but I be fat pretty...
answer: You don't remember when you met me once before...long ago...

question: I remember something... Wha's your name?
answer: You know my name! You came to my school, right before you win the title. Interviewed you for the school paper. I was eleven.

question: You had a long braid...
answer: Yeah! You called me little Indian girl, then.

question: That was you?
answer: I loved you then, like all those kids. I never stopped. I still do.

question: You see the Ellis-Quarry fight?
answer: Yes... We'll be in front of the U.S. Court of Appeals next month. We'll lose. Then we appeal to the Supreme Court.

question: Ellis the champ? Man. I beatin' on him since we was sixteen. They give Ellis to Joe Frazier? Frazier'll kill him. Then they out of juice. Where's the gate? So they gotta let me fight. I fight Ellis in a phone booth...middle of Times Square...you think that draw a crowd?
answer: Draw a crowd or not draw a crowd, Muhammad, is NOT going to make a difference with your boxing licenses. They don't want you to fight. ACLU's handling your case against the New York Boxing Commission. They discovered New York's got actual ex-murderers and ex-rapists currently licensed to fight. But revoked yours...?

question: Tijuana?
answer: No. State Department refused permission for the one-hour visa. No fight in Tijuana. Look...

question: Can't fight here. Can't fight outside the country...
answer: I know people in the restaurant business...want to start up a chain. Muhammad Ali's "Champ Burger"..."Muhammad Malts," "Fist Full of Fries"...all of that.

question: Why I want to be in the restaurant business?!
answer: 'Cause you need the money.

question: How much all this gonna cost?
answer: Too much. They do that to you, too, you know. Where you goin'?

question: ...struck out at the appellate level in New Orleans. So we're heading back to the Supreme Court...
answer: Thought we already got turned down there.

question: I'm petitioning on a conscientious objection basis. Religious belief. We'll petition that your sincere religious belief prohibits you from shooting people. I believe they'll hear that...
answer: Where the money come from, Chauncey? Herbert tell me I'm runnin' on empty. Put aside "how do that happen"? Licenses all revoked. No passport. I can't fight here. Can't fight abroad. And what happen if I lose the Supreme Court?

question: Ellis doesn't belong in there.
answer: Man give him a shot, he took a shot.

question: I saw Bundini in New York.
answer: How's he?

question: ...bad shape. You better get your belt b-b-back... Belinda brings coffee to Bingham...
answer: She's got to be done with that bottle.

question: You call your parents, Ali?
answer: No, he didn't. I told them about the one on the way...myself.

question: I'll call 'em, I'll call 'em... May-may! It go in one end and come out the other.
answer: You wanna try changing her, for the experience?

question: You so much better at it, mama. Maaan...Joe Frazier can't talk, can't up the gate, can't fill the arena. They gotta let me fight.
answer: That happen, you promise me you put some new people around you.

question: Hold on one second...we have a caller. Go ahead.
answer: Cosell? This Muhammad Ali. Go to Georgia or Alabama or Sweden. Everybody know I'm the champ. The crown is a lie. I know it's a lie. Joe Frazier know it's a lie. It time for everybody to stop lying and tell the truth.

question: Let's tell it like it is. With your court and boxing problems, Muhammad, can you get a fight promoted?
answer: I ain't interested in the paycheck, I'd fight Joe Frazier for free in a phone booth in Times Square, if I wasn't broke. I still will.

question: Did you say you were broke? How can you be broke? You've made more money than all previous heavyweight champions combined. What about your management? Surely they have provided for you...
answer: I'm saying it's time for everybody to quit lying! Muhammad Ali is the champ! I have to, I'll get the fight on myself. And if they offer me money, I ain't gonna turn it down.

question: Leave me alone!
answer: I leave you alone. You called me!

question: That were a week ago...
answer: What you shame yourself like this for, maaan...?! Why you shame yourself?!

question: Lemme alone! I'm flyin'! The Sky Chief talk through me. I know the word!
answer: You know "low." You so low, the curb look like up!

question: Yeah? The king gotta go home to his throne! From the root to the fruit...!
answer: Those rhymes is old. Forget 'em.

question: God don't care about you! Don't care about me! In all of everything, we mean nothin'. He don't know us. We be. And that's the onliest thing he did. And that's good 'cause that's why we free. But free ain't easy. Free is real. And realness is a motherfucker... It eats raw meat. It walk in its own shoes. It does not waver... Yeah... I sold your belt for five hundred dollars to a barber on Lenox Avenue. That's how low I did you. I'm filled with weakness and got a crazy mind. That belt say you the Heavyweight Champion of the World. Five hundred dollars and I put it into my arm. That's what I called to tell you... ...heard 'bout the Nation, all that court stuff.
answer: Yeah.

question: Forgive me, Muhammad. Take me back...
answer: No. There's no "back" to take you to... ...you can't do what you do best in the world. And how you feed your family? From prison? Who take care of your kids? And is Allah, is God with me? A thousand dollars to the man who brings me Howard Cosell's toupee! Dead or alive!

question: No. There's no "back" to take you to... ...you can't do what you do best in the world. And how you feed your family? From prison? Who take care of your kids? And is Allah, is God with me? A thousand dollars to the man who brings me Howard Cosell's toupee! Dead or alive!
answer: Don't bother me. I'm a world- famous broadcaster and you're an ex-champion with diminished skills. I can't be seen you, it would be calamitous to my reputation.

question: Put me on, Howard.
answer: Muhammad, I'd do anything for you. But I got bosses who only give a damn about Nielsen ratings.

question: I guarantee...it will be a historical and momentous night! ...what Heavyweight Champion of the World? I'm not the champ. I am retired, finished, out of the game. And I ain't gonna let myself grieve and suffer none. But I know I will not fight again...
answer: I thought you were resolute in your resolve to regain your crown...

question: If tomorrow they say
answer: What about Frazier?

question: You'll have to wonder...what me and Smokin' Joe would have looked like.
answer: You surprise me, Muhammad...

question: Howard, you losing your hearing along with your hair? Don't put questions to it! I am through fighting. 'Cause I got a bigger and more important match comin' up. The U.S. government. A heavier contender.
answer: Do you think you're going to jail?

question: I don't know, but it's going to be a shocking and terrible fight. In fact, they might wish they let me stay in boxing.
answer: Joe Frazier told me on this show he would knock you out.

question: There you go, agitatin'. You ask Smokin' Joe what he been smokin'?! Joe Frazier even dream he can whup me? He better wake up and apologize... But, if I WAS to jump in the ring with Joe, here's what you might see... Ali comes out to meet Frazier, but Frazier starts to retreat; If Frazier goes back an inch farther, he'll wind up in a ringside seat; Ali swings with a left, Ali swings with a right. Frazier keeps backin', but there's not enough room. It a matter of time before Ali lowers the boom; Now Ali lands with a right, what a beautiful swing, But the punch lifts Frazier clean out of the ring. Frazier's still risin', but the referee wears a frown, 'Cause he can't start countin' 'til Frazier come down. And Frazier's disappeared from view. And the crowd is getting frantic. Then our radar stations pick him up. He's somewhere over the Atlantic. Who would have thought when they came to this fight, That they would witness the launching of a black satellite? But don't wait for they fight. 'Cause it ain't never gonna happen. You only can wonder and imagine... You want me to buy you a drink? Ali's dad sits on a crate, painting the door of a delivery truck. He looks up...Ali is there. Emotion wells up in both men. The younger "rebelistic" son, seeing his father, who is so like him. The older hep-cat who got cheated by life of his potential and promise. In this case, his boy, his boy's name, pride and reflected glory... I don't wanna fight no more. Not with you... Who dress you, Joe? You look like Dale Evans.
answer: Shut up. Get in. What the hell you in Philly for? Philly my town.

question: To be closer to you, honey.
answer: Fuck you.

question: There be two undefeated heavyweight champions! And they ain't fighting!
answer: I wanna fight you! Said it a hundred times. The Man won't let you fight no more. What you complainin' to me for?

question: 'Cause you gotta get behind this and we gotta do this.
answer: We..."gotta" do nothin'!!!

question: You wanna get this on, Joe? You and me? Or not?!
answer: What about your license?

question: I can fight in Atlanta.
answer: How's that? What about the Boxing Commission?

question: Georgia ain't got no state boxing commission. And Atlanta got a black city council; a liberal Jewish mayor, Sam something. It all set. I do a prelim in Atlanta with Jerry Quarry. But we got to get the steamroller movin' now.
answer: What I got to do?

question: You announce that if I beat Quarry you give me the title shot. So what you say...maaan?
answer: My daddy was a sharecropper. I worked in a slaughterhouse...right on that corner. I came up from nothing. What I got, I got with this. And I already got the title. So I got nothing to win and everything to lose.

question: But you know you ain't the champ yet.
answer: Yeah..."yet." All right. You beat Quarry, I'll get inna ring and fuck you up... You need any money or anything to tide you by...?

question: What you want?
answer: Take me back, boss.

question: You want me to take you back?
answer: I'm clean. And you a resurrection. This is God's act. Anybody love poor people and little people and fucked-up people gotta be a prophet. And the prophet is going home. You the sun. Let me live in the light. Take me with, boss. ...I'll do anything.

question: You can't hit what you can't see.
answer: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee. You the man! You Superman! Ain't no kryptonite in this ring tonight!

question: As-Saalam Alaikum...Brother Muhammad...
answer: All praise to Allah... ...Alaikum Salaam...

question: The Messenger has lifted the suspension, Muhammad. Congratulations.
answer: You saying I can be a Muslim again, Herbert?

question: Yes.
answer: I never stopped. Like I never stopped being champ.

question: I begged my father to reinstate you.
answer: When? After I promoted Quarry fight? After I won it?

question: We can get you Frazier.
answer: I already got Frazier.

question: We can get you five million dollars for Frazier.
answer: Are we talking management, talking money or talking religion?

question: When you...
answer: When I got leery and talked up how come I'm broke, then came the suspension. Now, you explain that to me, my brother...?

question: It's my father...
answer: I love the Nation, Herbert. I love Elijah Muhammad. But it don't own me. Now, you go on out. And you make the Frazier deal.

question: My brother!
answer: Yeah...

question: is exhausted. Labored breathing. The crowd cheering Frazier.
answer: Hell of a fight, champ...

question: Shut up! I lost. Get outta here...
answer: Ferdie, take a look at this... It was still a hell of a fight.

question: What are they saying, man?!!! Why they saying that? What's that mean?! I don't understand! What?! Ali, boma ye! Ali, boma ye! Fast. Six left jabs flash from his chest and shoulder, followed by a right hook and left and right uppercuts. Back up, maaan... ...you fast! Ali, boma ye George Foreman! You out, sucker! Curious, Ali runs behind the green signs from where the kids came. looks at the backs of the signs. He and we realize the signs' purpose Foreman? I kill him! looks at individual faces. A grinning OLDER MAN with a blue transistor radio . A smiling kid. A girl with no shoes. A teenage kid jumping up and down...all looking at him. Ali makes four pieces of rope appear. He rubs them together... Shazaam!!! ...even if I die here. If it kill me, no matter what...I gotta win. Howard! How many you ugly sportswriters in there got me over Foreman? Don't lie.
answer: Some of us...Norman, me...are worried. How you gonna dance against George?? He's sparring with a middleweight, training to cut you off. He gets you against the ropes, he can knock you out with either hand.

question: What's the odds?
answer: Two-and-a-half-to-one. Against. We're worried you're going to get hurt.

question: This'll be the biggest upset since Sonny Liston. I want all of you to write it down! This fight is no contest! George Foreman is a big mummy. I've officially named him "The Mummy." George punches are like "Look out, here come the left." Whomp! Here come the right! Whomp! Like a Mummy. But "The Mummy" can't hit what it can't see. I'm fast! Gonna dance. Be all over George. George is gonna feel he surrounded. And I done somethin' new for this fight; I done rassled with an alligator. Anticipatory laughter. They've had twelve years' experience of Ali's stand-up and know when a new routine's starting... That's right! I have rassled with an alligator. I done tussled with a whale. I done handcuffed lightning, thrown thunder in jail. That's bad! Only last week I murdered a rock. Injured a stone. Hospitalized a brick. I'm so mean, I make medicine sick.
answer: Muhammad, I'm sorry. I have to ask. Are you really fast enough, anymore? To beat George Foreman? Many people believe you don't have the same skills, that you are not the same man you used to be ten years ago.

question: Salaam Alaikum, brothers! The champ is here!
answer: Here's your water.

question: Bottled water. Frozen steaks. Brought all this stuff like Africans don't have steaks...
answer: You could pick up parasites...

question: They eat it.
answer: You're seeing what you want to see, Muhammad...

question: Mobutu eats it...
answer: Mobutu is taking care of Mobutu and stealing all the wealth and sending it to Switzerland...

question: So? What's that do with any of why we here?
answer: We're here 'cause Don King got Mobutu to put up ten million dollars. Don King don't give a damn about Africa. He worse than Herbert.

question: Here come "Herbert."
answer: Yeah. 'Cause where was he when we was broke and borrowing money? And Bundini and all them that "love you"? Disappeared, is where they were. All over you when you got it and drop off you when you don't...

question: Money? I do "money-making" whenever I want. Money is easy.
answer: And Don King fit right in...that double-breasted hipster is now a dashiki-wearing rip-off.

question: Don King delivered the first black- promoted championship fight in Africa!
answer: Don King talks black, lives white and thinks green! Why you defending him and "brother" Herbert?

question: 'Cause clean-cut Muslims parading on the South Side of Chicago don't get this done! I got to put honkeys with connections and bad- ass niggers to it, too.
answer: And now they got you up against George Foreman. Do they give a damn you could get killed?

question: That what this is? Think I gonna lose? Puttin' doubt on me?
answer: I think Maryum is sick. Maybe I oughta go back to Chicago and look after her.

question: Sure.
answer: I'll be back before the fight. If that's all right, my husband...

question: Champ! Champ! George had an accident.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: Got cut. Right above his right eye. His sparring partner's elbow. Split it open, so...
answer: Can he fight?

question: Not for six weeks. This is not a humorous situation, my champion. This postponement could be long, especially if George leaves.
answer: Are you tryin' to pull something, Don? Ali wants his title. And he wants it back in Zaire. George leaves, he ain't comin' back. George don't like it here.

question: How right you are, my suspicious and short Italian brother. And my fiduciary responsibility to this first all-black promotion is like a garden in the African sun. It must grow! It must bloom! It cannot flower in the gloom and shade of postponement to some dome. Like the Astrodome, the Super-dome, any dome outta Zaire, where it be deprived of light and bled of water. 'Cause what gonna bleed...is money. A hemorrhage of cash. ...blood on the floor. Double hotel costs. Double travel costs. Airplanes. Food and beverage...
answer: What do you expect us to do, Don?

question: Muhammad. Find a way to get George to stay. Be Moses in reverse
answer: L-l-l-lingala.

question: What?
answer: Lingala. They s-s-s-speak Lingala.

question: If George goes? George goes, my champion, I will get you Joe Frazier. Ali-Frazier III...the fight everybody want to see.
answer: Truth is...George knocked hisself out. That's right. He did three rounds. Knew he was gonna lose to Muhammad Ali and knocked hisself out. And I predict that whenever the fight is set, he might not show up!

question: You bad!
answer: I'm a bad man!

question: Ain't no doubt about it.
answer: And you tell the same thing to George. I been watchin' you! I heard you. I know he's your man. I know you got him picked. But the man's in trouble. The whole world was gonna know. But, now, he ain't gonna show. That's why he knocked hisself out when he was training.

question: We will reschedule the fight, and to ensure George is ready, we are thinking of postponing from September 24th to October 30th. That would go off as planned on September 22nd and 23rd.
answer: Uh-huh. I want all helicopters guarded! Private boats. Private jets. I want the airport -- I'm serious -- I want President Mobutu and all his paratroopers. Mobutu and all his paratroopers. I want all of you "Zaireans" to be on guard! Watch all strange boats tryin' to slip away! They might be takin' him out.

question: Hey!!! Don't talk to Angelo like that! Don't you talk to him like that ever again!!! You think you're callin' these shots, Don? You're not. They know! All those ladies out there know. They know I'm ready! I see fear in the eyes of his followers! I see fear! This is the fight that Muhammad Ali was supposed to be ended. The myth of Muhammad was supposed to fall! Supposed to be my destruction! They miscalculated. They misjudged. They got it...wrong. Say, girl...! C'mere. I know you?
answer: I don't think so.

question: What's your name?
answer: Veronica Porche.

question: Like the sports car.
answer: Yes.

question: But with a little something extra. Veronica, I know you now. C'mere, sit down. You with Don?
answer: Don brought me here, but I'm not "with"...anybody.

question: Where you from?
answer: L.A. But my people are from Louisiana. We're Creole. So I'm African, French, Spanish, my mother's grandfather was Jewish.

question: Well...they all came together real nice.
answer: You know... ...I'm glad you said what you did. You made sure this fight stays here.

question: All them writers in there think Foreman gonna...kill me! What you think?
answer: Ali, boma ye.

question: Ladies in Thailand, their hair comes down to their knees...and they about Veronica's complexion...and they bad! But they ain't nothin' like the "sisters." Ain't NOTHIN' like the sisters! Let's go for a ride.
answer: squints, trying to figure out how he did it, because...

question: shows the scarf, pushes back his cuffs so that he can't hide anything up his sleeves. His wrists are bare. He shows both sides. Now, he takes the scarf and pushes with his right hand and feeds it into the closed fist of his left. He looks up wide-eyed at everybody. Then, he opens his fingers and the scarf is not there! So why you glad we still here?
answer: Holdin' this in Africa make people proud. All over the world. They're proud of you. Anybody can fight in Vegas.

question: That's one job. I got two... ...gotta whup George!
answer: Islamic faith help you to that?

question: When did you get in?
answer: Just now. Muhammad, may I have a word with you, please? What is going on?

question: You know what's going on.
answer: But I don't have to have it thrown in my face. I don't have to read about it and have people call me up on the phone about it...

question: I didn't mean for it to come out...
answer: Oh, hell, Muhammad, you got no discretion. You never did. You humiliate me! I clean for you. I cook for you. I feel every punch you take.

question: I know that.
answer: Then why you got to be visible with women?

question: I didn't mean for it to be...
answer: I live with the casual ones. But this, this...I can't hold it together anymore.

question: I don't want to hurt you. It's wrong. You're a good wife to me.
answer: Then why do you disrespect me this way?!

question: I respect you. I always respect you.
answer: Do you love her? Do you want to marry her?

question: I follow my heart.
answer: "You're following your heart"? That's what you do. No matter what anybody says. Or thinks. Or what it does... And what happens now?

question: I fight George. I didn't come this far to quit.
answer: Neither of us did.

question: Give us a moment. Alone. Hey. This is my religion! It's hot. Humid. Monsoon season's about to start. May hit 140 in the ring under the lights. You all right?
answer: Why?

question: Where you at?
answer: Foreman ain't no mummy. He's knocked out eight out of eleven before the end of the third round. He the most dangerous fighter I ever fought.

question: I'd worry if I was hearin' anything else.
answer: And I can't WAIT!

question: Now, both of you know the rules. When I step back, I want a good, clean break. No hitting below the belt, no kidney punches, no...
answer: Motherfucker, you 'bout to discover you ain't nothin'.

question: Ali, be quiet! No kidney punches. Now...
answer: You been hearin' about me for years. All your life you been hearin' about Muhammad Ali. Now you gotta face me.

question: Ali, I'll disqualify you. Now, I want a good, clean, sportsman fight...
answer: You never should have come to Africa.

question: All right!! Now go to your corners and come out fighting when you hear the bell, and may the best man...win...
answer: Legs heavy...air's heavy...like sand...

question: ...been here before.
answer: Ali, move! Dance, champ!

question: Open the door, Richard...outta this room... Put on your coat, man...get out... Think my fight's over...? That... ...all you got? That the hardest you hit? C'mon, chump!!!
answer: Get off the goddamn ropes!!

question: They don't know what's happenin'. You bet the wrong horse! He can't fight no better than you can act! covers with gloves at his head. Elbows at his ribs. When head shots come in, Ali slips them the right or left, or turns them into glancing shots, or just leans straight back so that they all fall short by quarter of an inch. The BELL. covering, taking the most powerful hooks Foreman's thrown in the fight, one after the other to the body. Take it! Terrify him with what you can take...
answer: desperate, pounds a left to Ali's side, a blocked left to the head, three lefts to the belly, which get through! Ali's left arm convulses downwards, involuntarily, with the blows. What Ali's not ready for and doesn't block is the right hand that follows. This shot is jarring and concussive. He grabs Foreman's neck and has to hold on.

question: Eight more rounds... You runnin' outta gas? ...can't let you get that second wind which you don't know is out there for you. Want the title...wear the heavyweight crown? Jaw broke? Nose smashed? Face busted? You ready to die? Is that you? 'Cause you gonna meet a man who will die before he let you win.
answer: gets in a couple of lefts that Ali deflects. Ali takes another on the cheek, leans way back again. Suddenly, he seems tired, as is Foreman. Tied up, they go diagonally to the other corner of the ring, both fighters exhausted, leaning against each other. Resting. BUT... backs Ali into the corner.
